clinical_study.brief_title: LLETZ Under General Versus Local Anesthesia
clinical_study.official_title: Large Loop Excision of the Transformatione Zone Under General Versus Local Anesthesia: a Randomized Trial.

lead_sponsor.agency: Zydolab - Institute of Cytology and Immune Cytochemistry

clinical_study.source: Zydolab - Institute of Cytology and Immune Cytochemistry

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators conduct a prospective, randomized trial to assess the benefits of performing large loop excision of the transformatione zone (LLETZ) under local anesthesia and compare it to LLETZ under general anesthesia. The primary endpoint of this study is womenÂ´s satisfaction.

primary_outcome.description: Patients will score their satisfaction by using a 11-step visual analogue scale (VAS) ranging from '0' ("not satisfied at all") to '10' ("very satisfied") 2 hours after Treatment

secondary_outcome.description: patients will score their postoperative pain Level using a 11-step visual analogue scale (VAS) ranging from '0' ("no pain" ) to '10' ("maximum pain") within 2 hours after surgery
the resected cone mass will be quantified by weighing the removed tissue with a precision scale located in the operating room
the time from the beginning of the Operation (start of the electrosurgical method) until the end of the operation (the end of hemostatic interventions) will be measured in minutes
Operative complications defined as necessity to intervene therapeutically up to 14 days postoperatively
the time until complete hemostasis as judged by the surgeon has been achieved, will be measured in seconds
Surgeons will score their satisfaction by using a 11-step visual analogue scale (VAS) 20 minutes after Treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: number of fragments of the surgical specimen
secondary_outcome.description: surgeons will count the number of the surgical specimen (1 vs. >1)

secondary_outcome.measure: the dimensions of the surgical specimens
secondary_outcome.description: The circumference, length and thickness of The surgical specimens will be measured
intraoperative blood loss will be measured using the difference in serum hemoglobin one day prior to surgery and within 5 hours postoperatively

Resection margin is judge as "R0" if abnormal cells are not found in the margin of the biopsy or "R1" if abnormal cells remain in the margin of the biopsy. The histopathological examination will be done by an Independent pathologist

arm_group.description: The LLETZ procedure will be performed under local anaesthesia
The LLETZ procedure will be performed under general anaesthesia

intervention.description: Conization will be performed under local anaesthesia
Conization will be performed under general anaesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- colposcopy Prior to conization
- informed consent
- histologically proven high grade cervical dysplasia
- Transformation zone typ 1 or 2
Exclusion Criteria:
- significant language barrier
- a personal history of conization
- pregnancy
- the use of blood thinner
- unwillingness to participate
- oncological disease
- inpatient treatment
- women who are not fasting
- risk of aspiration
- columnar-squamous epithelium border not fully visible
